title: Spring force - block on a spring in an elevator

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> hangs in equilibrium from an ideal spring inside an elevator, as shown. The elevator moves downward at a constant speed and the length of the spring is <math alttext="x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The elevator then gradually slows to a stop with constant acceleration. Which of the following statements correctly describes the length of the spring while the elevator is decelerating?

choices.label: It is constant and equal to <math alttext="x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
It is constant and greater than <math alttext="x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
It is constant and less than <math alttext="x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
It starts off greater than <math alttext="x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and slowly decreases.

content.answer: It is constant and greater than <math alttext="x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
